department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
description: The Canadian Intellectual Property Office of Innovation, Science, and Economic Development Canada (ISED) has a requirement for two Scanners to scan both microfiche and microfilms, as well as required accessories.
full_summary:
=====================================

**Government Tender Announcement**

**Title:** Scanning Equipment for Physical and Digital Records

**Tender Reference Number:** WS4084148028-Doc4289741316

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)

**Request Date:** November 2, 2023
**Submission Deadline:** November 24, 2023, 2:00p.m. EST

**Pre-Quotes Date:** July 28, 2023
**Contract End Date:** March 31, 2024

**Procurement Method:** Competitive Bidding
**Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price

**Delivery Location:** Gatineau, Quebec, Canada

**Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Overview:**

The Canadian Intellectual Property Office of Innovation, Science, and Economic Development Canada (ISED) invites bids for the acquisition of two Scanning Equipment units capable of scanning microfiche and microfilm records along with required accessories. The units must meet specific requirements to support the digitization of physical records and ensure long-term preservation.

**Eligibility Requirements:**

* Bidders are required to demonstrate compliance with the procurement requirements outlined in this notice.
* Suppliers must provide relevant proof of their ability to manufacture and deliver the scanning equipment.
* A detailed technical specification for the scanning equipment is included in the bid package.

**Submission Requirements:**

* Respondents must submit their bid proposals electronically.
* Bid packages can be downloaded from the Ariba Discovery Page [insert URL].

**Procurement Agency:**

* Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* Address:
  11 Laurier Street (Phase III)
  Place du Portage 
  Gatineau, QC K1A 0S5 Canada

**Contact Information:**

* Samantha Phelan (elle-la-lui / she-her-hers)
(PSPC/SPAC)
Phone: None
Email: [samantha.phelan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:ssamantha.phelan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca) 
Address: Same as above

The contract is expected to be awarded after the selection process has been completed. Any further instructions will be provided to the shortlisted bidders. Bidders can contact PSPC for further information on this procurement process.



Under Local Pressure
